ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: It's a good class if you're interested in qualitative methods and want to prepare to do your own research.

I would recommend this class to any student who plans on conducting qualitative research. And for those who intend to incorporate ethnographic work, I would recommend it in addition to or in lieu of the field methods course offered in Poly Sci. This course will help a student prepare and launch her research. It is equally perfect for a student developing a research project for a second-year paper or a dissertation prospectus.

I would summarize this course as an introduction to qualitative research design and methods with an emphasis on publishing in general sociology journals. I would recommend this course to any student interested in qualitative research and would go further to suggest that this course is essential for such students, especially in the sociology department.
Take it before starting a research.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It helped me understand better the complexities on qualitative research.
It helped me think through and write my IRB application and design a qualitative research study that may evolve into my dissertation project.
I feel much more prepared to conduct my fieldwork and significantly better equipped to pursue publication of my research in general sociology journals.
Be clear about the steps of designing a research.
